original: Björck, Gotthard Ferdinand, chefredaktör, Mariestad, f. 6/4/87 i N. Asum, Krist. 1., av folksk :lär. Olof B. o. Anna Nilsson. G. 17 m. Siri-Lisa Malmgren. Barn: Gunnar Olof f. 19, d. s. å., Ulla 23, Inga 26. — Stud:ex. v. Kristianstads h. a. 1. 06. Res. t. Tyskl., Danm. o. Norge. Medarb., sederm. red:sekr. i Gefle-Posten 07-10, red:-sekr. o. polit. medarb. i Barometern 10-19, red:sekr. i Örebro Dagbl. 19, red. o. utg. av Tidn. f. Skarab. Län o. verkst. dir. där 19-20, andre red. i Örebro Dagbl. 20-21, därefter åter red. o. utg. av Tidn. f. Skarab. Län i Mariestad. Ordf. i Sv. provinspressens fören. o. i Västergötl. tidn :utg :fören., styr :l’ed. o. verkst. dir. i A-B Tidn. f. Skarab. Län, styr :led. i Boktryck, in-tresseorg. o. Sv. tidn :utg :fören., rev. i Tidn. arb :giv :fören., komp :chef f. hemv. i Marieislad 40-46. Medk av Publ:-kl., SHT, FrimuraTeorden o. Göt. förb. RVO, FMM.
translated: Björck, Gotthard Ferdinand, editor-in-chief, Mariestad, b. 6/4/87 in N. Asum, Krist. 1., son of schoolteacher Olof B. and Anna Nilsson. Married to Siri-Lisa Malmgren in 17. Children: Gunnar Olof b. 19, d. same year, Ulla 23, Inga 26. Studied at Kristianstad's high school graduating in 06. Traveled to Germany, Denmark, and Norway. Worked as a collaborator, later secretary and political collaborator at Gefle-Posten from 07-10, secretary and political collaborator at Barometern from 10-19, and at Örebro Dagbl. from 19. Editor and publisher of Tidn. f. Skarab. Län and director there from 19-20, second editor of Örebro Dagbl. from 20-21, and then again editor and publisher at Tidn. f. Skarab. Län in Mariestad. Chairman of the Swedish Provincial Press Association and the Västergötl. Magazine Publishers Association, board member and managing director at A-B Tidn. f. Skarab. Län, board member at Boktryck, an interest group, and the Swedish Magazine Publishers Association, reviewed by Tidn. arb. :giv. :fören., and Chief of the Home Guard in Marieislad from 40-46. Member of Publ:-kl., SHT, Freemasonry Order, and Göt. förb. RVO, FMM.
